detaileddescription.para: Convert an RHF wave function model to an UHF wave function model.

parameterdescription.para: an RHF wave function model

simplesect.para: The (spin-resolved) UHF 1-DM expressed in an orthonormal spin-orbital basis for these UHF model parameters.
The (spin-resolved) UHF 2-DM expressed in an orthonormal spin-orbital basis for these UHF model parameters.
We assume that the total number of alpha and beta orbitals is the same.
The spin resolved UHF 1-DM expressed in the underlying scalar basis for these UHF model parameters.

memberdef.argsstring: (const USQHamiltonian< Scalar > &usq_hamiltonian, const Spin sigma, const Spin sigma_bar) const
memberdef.name: calculateMixedSpinConservedAComponent

detaileddescription.para: Construct a mixed-spin component of the spin-conserved stability matrix A'.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: A'_I(sigma)A(sigma)J(sigma_bar)B(sigma_bar) = (A(sigma)I(sigma)|J(sigma_bar)B(sigma_bar)).
Sigma_bar = alpha if sigma is beta and vice versa.
The name Spin-conservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.
The spin-sigma component.
The spin component, opposite to sigma.

simplesect.para: The mixed spin sigma component of stability matrix A'.

memberdef.argsstring: (const USQHamiltonian< Scalar > &usq_hamiltonian, const Spin sigma, const Spin sigma_bar) const
memberdef.name: calculateMixedSpinConservedBComponent

detaileddescription.para: Construct a mixed-spin component of the spin-conserved stability matrix B'.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: B'_I(sigma)A(sigma)J(sigma_bar)B(sigma_bar) = (A(sigma)I(sigma)|B(sigma_bar)J(sigma_bar)).
Sigma_bar = alpha if sigma is beta and vice versa.
The name Spin-conservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.
The spin-sigma component.
The spin component, opposite to sigma.

simplesect.para: The mixed spin sigma component of stability matrix B'.

memberdef.argsstring: (const USQHamiltonian< Scalar > &usq_hamiltonian, const Spin sigma) const
memberdef.name: calculatePureSpinConservedAComponent

detaileddescription.para: Construct a pure-spin component of the spin-conserved stability matrix A'.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: A'_I(sigma)A(sigma)J(sigma)B(sigma) = \delta_I(sigma)J(sigma) * F_B(sigma)A(sigma) - \delta_B(sigma)A(sigma) * F_I(sigma)J(sigma) + (A(sigma)I(sigma)||J(sigma)B(sigma)).
The name Spin-conservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.
The spin-sigma component. This method creates a pure spin component, so all sigma's in the formula are either alpha or beta.

simplesect.para: The pure spin sigma component of stability matrix A'.

memberdef.argsstring: (const USQHamiltonian< Scalar > &usq_hamiltonian, const Spin sigma) const
memberdef.name: calculatePureSpinConservedBComponent

detaileddescription.para: Construct a pure-spin component of the spin-conserved stability matrix B'.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: B'_I(sigma)A(sigma)J(sigma)B(sigma) = (A(sigma)I(sigma)||B(sigma)J(sigma)).
The name Spin-conservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.
The spin-sigma component. This method creates a pure spin component, so all sigma's in the formula are either alpha or beta.

simplesect.para: The pure spin sigma component of stability matrix B'.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the complete spin-conserved stability matrix A'.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: A' = (A'_aaaa A'_aabb) (A'_bbaa A'_bbbb).
The name Spin-conservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The complete stability matrix A'.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the complete spin-conserved stability matrix B'.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: B' = (B'_aaaa B'_aabb) (B'_bbaa B'_bbbb).
The name Spin-conservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The complete stability matrix B'.

memberdef.argsstring: (const USQHamiltonian< Scalar > &usq_hamiltonian, const Spin sigma, const Spin sigma_bar) const
memberdef.name: calculateSpinUnconservedAComponent

detaileddescription.para: Construct a component of the spin-unconserved stability matrix A''.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: A''_I(sigma)A(sigma_bar)J(sigma)B(sigma_bar) = \delta_I(sigma)J(sigma) * F_B(sigma_bar)A(sigma_bar) - \delta_B(sigma_bar)A(sigma_bar) * F_I(sigma)J(sigma) - (A(sigma_bar)B(sigma_bar)|J(sigma)I(sigma)).
Sigma_bar = alpha if sigma is beta and vice versa.
The name Spin-unconservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.
The spin-sigma component.
The spin component, opposite to sigma.

simplesect.para: A component of stability matrix A''.

inbodydescription.para: The mixed alpha-beta two electron integrals are extracted from the Hamiltonian.

memberdef.argsstring: (const USQHamiltonian< Scalar > &usq_hamiltonian, const Spin sigma, const Spin sigma_bar) const
memberdef.name: calculateSpinUnconservedBComponent

detaileddescription.para: Construct a component of the spin-unconserved stability matrix B''.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: B''_I(sigma)A(sigma_bar)J(sigma_bar)B(sigma) = - (A(sigma_bar)J(sigma_bar)|B(sigma)I(sigma)).
Sigma_bar = alpha if sigma is beta and vice versa.
The name Spin-unconservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.
The spin-sigma component.
The spin component, opposite to sigma.

simplesect.para: A component of stability matrix B''.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the complete spin-unconserved stability matrix A''.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: A'' = (A''_abab 0 ) ( 0 A''_baba).
The name Spin-unconservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The complete stability matrix A''.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the complete spin-unconserved stability matrix B''.

simplesect.para: The formula for this component is as follows: B'' = ( 0 B''_abba) (B''_baab 0 ).
The name Spin-unconservedcomes from the article "Constraints and stability in Hartree-Fock theory" by Seeger, R. and Pople J.A. (https://doi.org/10.1063/1.434318).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The complete stability matrix B''.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the UHF stability matrices and return them.

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'unrestricted' spin orbital basis of the UHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The UHF stability matrices.

parameterdescription.para: The spin-sigma component.

simplesect.para: A matrix containing all the possible excitation energies of the wavefunction model, belonging to a certain spin component.
The rows are determined by the number of virtual sigma orbitals, the columns by the number of occupied sigma orbitals.
The transformation that expresses the UHF MOs in terms of the underlying AOs.
The number of alpha and beta electrons that these UHF model parameters describe, i.e. the number of occupied alpha- & beta-spin-orbitals.
the total number of spin-orbitals that these UHF model parameters describe

parameterdescription.para: alpha or beta

simplesect.para: the number of sigma spin-orbitals that these UHF model parameters describe

parameterdescription.para: The alpha or beta spin component.

simplesect.para: The orbital energies belonging to the occupied orbitals of spin component sigma.
The orbital energies of the alpha and beta orbitals.
The implicit alpha and beta occupied-virtual orbital spaces that are associated to these UHF model parameters.
all the spin-orbital energies, with the alpha spin-orbital energies appearing before the beta spin-orbital energies

parameterdescription.para: The alpha or beta spin component.

simplesect.para: The orbital energies belonging to the virtual orbitals of spin component sigma.

memberdef.name: calculateError

the sigma-spin density matrix in the AO basis
the overlap matrix of the AO basis

simplesect.para: the sigma-spin error matrix
